intro: Octolepis dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's spurge, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It possesses milky sap, a common feature among members of the spurge family. Octolepis dinklagei is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
